fr.atis_lab.physicalworld

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.atis_lab.physicalworld.Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Sprite>

    public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Sprite>, java.io.Serializable
    Sprite is their to allow painting capacities and unique name to JBox2D Bodies
    Version:
    12/2013
    Author:
    A. Gademer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String name,
      int layerIndex,
      java.awt.Color color,
      javax.swing.ImageIcon icon)
        Create a new Sprite
        Parameters:
        name - the Sprite name (must be unique in the PhysicalWorld)
        layerIndex - the layerIndex allow to sort PhysicalObject from front (higher values) to bottom (lower values)
        color - the color of the geometrical shape drawn (null if you want an invisible object)
        icon - an image to represent the object (null if no image)

      • rotatedPaint

        public static void rotatedPaint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                javax.swing.Icon icon,
                int x,
                int y,
                float scaleX,
                float scaleY,
                int offX,
                int offY,
                float angle)
        Mystic function to rotate, translate and scale the ImageIcon before painting
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics context where to draw
        icon - the Icon to be painted
        x - the x-coordinate for translation
        y - the y-coordinate for translation
        scaleX - the horizontal scale factor
        scaleY - the vertical scale factor
        offX - x-coordinate of the offset to the rotation center
        offY - y-coordinate of the offset to the rotation center
        angle - the rotation angle

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Sprite other)
        Compare the layerIndex between this Sprite and another Sprite.
        We sort the Sprite by their layer higher layerIndex means in front of other Sprite
        Implementation of the Comparable interface
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Sprite>
        Parameters:
        other - the other Sprite
        Returns:
        -1 if the current object is in front of the other, 1 if the current object is behind the other, 0 is they are at the same level.

      • extractSprite

        public static Sprite extractSprite(Body body)
        Static method to extract the Sprite from a Body instance
        It is a static method of Sprite because we cannot modify the Body class
        Parameters:
        body - the targetted Body
        Returns:
        the associated Sprite
